course.course_title: Topics in Applied Mathematics: Waves and Imaging

slide.text:
40 CHAPTER 1. WAVE EQUATIONS Explain this observation theoretically. [Hint: boundary condition] 4. First, show the multivariable rule of integration by parts fg=
fg, when fand gare smooth and decay fast at innity, by invoking the divergence theorem. Second, use this result to show that L=Lfor variable-density acoustics (section 1.1.1), i.e., show that /angbracketleftLw, w/prime/angbracketright=/angbracketleftw, Lw/prime/angbracketrightfor all reasonable functions wandw/prime, and where /angbracketleft,/angbracketrightis the adequate notion of inner product seen in section 1.1.1. 5. Show that /angbracketleftLw, w/prime/angbracketright=/angbracketleftw, Lw/prime/angbracketrightfor general elastic waves. 6. Predict that elastic waves can only propagate at speeds cPorcS, by studying plane wave solutions of the form rei(kxt )(for some xed vector rR3), for the elastic equation (1.5) with constant parameters , , . 7. InR2, consider 2/parenleftbigg/parenrightbiggcof(x)= eikx sd, k =|k| , 0sin with |k|=/c.
